message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.IR. 

The paper focuses on developing a system for temporal action localization using single-frame supervision, which involves identifying only a single frame within the temporal window of an action. This falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The proposed system, SF-Net, involves predicting actionness scores for each video frame and mining pseudo action and background frames based on the single-frame annotations, which involves machine learning (cs.LG) and multimedia (cs.MM) techniques. The system also involves training a classifier using the labeled and pseudo-labeled frames, which involves artificial intelligence (cs.AI) techniques. Finally, the paper discusses related work on action recognition and localization, which involves information retrieval (cs.IR) techniques.
